item.title: Edina add a quote by Prophet Muhammad
item.description: "ما يصيب المسلم من نصب ولا وصب ولا همّ ولا حزن ولا أذى ولا غمّ - حتى الشوكة يشاكها - إلا كفّر الله بها مِن خطاياه No fatigue, disease, sorrow, sadness, hurt or distress befalls a Muslim - not even the prick he receives from a thorn - except that Allah expiates some of his sins because of it. (<i>Sahih al-Bukhari</i>, Book 70, #545)" -- Prophet Muhammad

item.title: Edina add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Everybody is a genius. But if you judge a fish by its ability to climb a tree, it will live its whole life believing that it is stupid." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Edina add a quote by Gil Scott-Heron
item.description: "You never cared enough to be Black " -- Gil Scott-Heron

item.title: Edina add a quote by Sean O'Casey
item.description: "When it was dark, you always carried the sun in your hand for me." -- Sean O'Casey

item.title: Edina add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "A wonderful fact to reflect upon, that every human creature is constituted to be that profound secret and mystery to every other." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Edina add a quote by Henry Ward Beecherr
item.description: "Where is human nature so weak as in the bookstore?" -- Henry Ward Beecherr

item.title: Edina add a quote by Chrostopher Logue
item.description: "Come to the edge.' 'We can't. We're afraid.' 'Come to the edge.' 'We can't. We will fall!' 'Come to the edge.' And they came. And he pushed them. And they flew." -- Chrostopher Logue

item.title: Edina add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Edina add a quote by Khalil Gibran
item.description: "We are all like the bright moon, we still have our darker side." -- Khalil Gibran

item.title: Edina add a quote by Jean de La Fontaine
item.description: "A person often meets his destiny on the road he took to avoid it." -- Jean de La Fontaine

item.title: Edina add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Edina add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "You buy furniture. You tell yourself, this is the last sofa I will ever need in my life. Buy the sofa, then for a couple years you're satisfied that no matter what goes wrong, at least you've got your sofa issue handled. Then the right set of dishes. Then the perfect bed. The drapes. The rug. Then you're trapped in your lovely nest, and the things you used to own, now they own you." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Edina add a quote by Rob Brezsny
item.description: "Your face is true and your hair is perfect and I love you. You make boats in my dreams and you speak without words and I love you. Your fears unnerve me and your questions amuse me and I love you. I love you not only for who you are, but for the interesting person I become when I’m with you. I say I love you and love you and love you until the words become the constant song of your voice in my head and the original ache of memory in my soul. I love you more than life and death, more than everything that’s in between the light and the dark. Do you believe me? Try harder. Do you believe me now? I’m always with you, which is why I know you will never abandon yourself." -- Rob Brezsny

item.title: Edina add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "I have often reflected upon the new vistas that reading has opened to me. I knew right there in prison that reading had changed forever the course of my life. As I see it today, the ability to read awoke inside me some long dormant craving to be mentally alive." -- Malcolm X

item.title: Edina add a quote by Arundhati Roy
item.description: "To love. To be loved. To never forget your own insignificance. To never get used to the unspeakable violence and the vulgar disparity of life around you. To seek joy in the saddest places. To pursue beauty to its lair. To never simplify what is complicated or complicate what is simple. To respect strength, never power. Above all, to watch. To try and understand. To never look away. And never, never to forget." -- Arundhati Roy

item.title: Edina add a quote by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
item.description: "In character, in manner, in style, in all the things, the supreme excellence is simplicity" -- Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

item.title: Edina add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "Muhammad has always been standing higher than the Christianity. He does not consider god as a human being and never makes himself equal to God. Muslims worship nothing except God and Muhammad is his Messenger. There is no any mystery and secret in it." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Edina add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Strange as it may seem, I still hope for the best, even though the best, like an interesting piece of mail, so rarely arrives, and even when it does it can be lost so easily." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Edina add a quote by Prophet Muhammad
item.description: "ليس الشديد بالصرعة؛ إنما الشديد الذي يملك نفسه عند الغضب The strong person is not the good wrestler. Rather,the strong person is the one who controls himself when he is angry. (<i>Sahih al-Bukhari</i>, Book 73, #135)" -- Prophet Muhammad

item.title: Edina add a quote by Prophet Muhammad
item.description: "من قال عليّ ما لم أقل فليتبوأ مقعده من النار Whoever ascribes to me what I have not said then let him occupy his seat in Hell-fire! (<i>Sahih al-Bukhari</i>, Book 3, #109)" -- Prophet Muhammad

item.title: Edina add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "People always clap for the wrong reasons." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Edina add a quote by Francesco Petrarca
item.description: "Rarely do great beauty and great virtue dwell together." -- Francesco Petrarca

item.title: Edina add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "To educate a person in the mind but not in morals is to educate a menace to society." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: Edina add a quote by Khaled Hosseini
item.description: "There are a lot of children in Afghanistan, but little childhood." -- Khaled Hosseini

item.title: Edina add a quote by Khaled Hosseini
item.description: "When you kill a man, you steal a life. You steal his wife's right to a husband, rob his children of a father. When you tell a lie, you steal someone's right to the truth. When you cheat, you steal the right to fairness." -- Khaled Hosseini

item.title: Edina add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "Either write something worth reading or do something worth writing." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Edina add a quote by Dale Carnegie
item.description: "Develop success from failures. Discouragement and failure are two of the surest stepping stones to success." -- Dale Carnegie

item.title: Edina add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Pain and suffering are always inevitable for a large intelligence and a deep heart. The really great men must, I think, have great sadness on earth." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Edina add a quote by Robert Penn Warren
item.description: "Tell me a story of deep delight." -- Robert Penn Warren

item.title: Edina add a quote by Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "My mind," he said, "rebels at stagnation. Give me problems, give me work, give me the most abstruse cryptogram or the most intricate analysis, and I am in my own proper atmosphere. I can dispense then with artificial stimulants. But I abhor the dull routine of existence. I crave for mental exaltation. That is why I have chosen my own particular profession, or rather created it, for I am the only one in the world." -- Arthur Conan Doyle
